text:
Hello, I need help with this endpoint: <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/products/search>
how can I return previous result? I'm able to us the `{"after": intValue}` for next result, but how do I go back from the current data returned

Hi Everyone, As I am going through the most recent HubSpot plugin update, I still get the same issue and seems like HubSpot is still not active for Full Site Editor. I am trying to console wp.blocks.getBlockTypes() on wordpress Editor screen but could not find
leadin/HubSpot-form-block and also page breaks if I try to add any block which is same old issue. Please let me know if you have any solutions.
I’m not sure this is the right place for this. I’m not even sure I understand wha tyou are asking. This sounds like a HubSpot plugin issue?

Generally you just put all that data into an object and go next. I’m not sure there is a previous. I’ve never even thought to go back.

What is the use case here? The concept of using these apis is to only retrieve the information once, reloading something that you’ve already accessed doesn’t make sense

This is a data integrity issue. Unless they are specifying a label you should be using and that exists.

If a contact has more than one company and you are suppsoed to be interacting with it, you need to setup HubSpot correctly to only allow one company, to manage labels correctly, etc.
I do not believe so

You need to go into HubSpot, edit the email, make sure it is saved for automation

`<https://app.HubSpot.com/email/HUBID/edit/EMAILID/content>`

where emailid, that is the id of the email
not going to be able to access that data, no api

create lists to help you identify the uses in each of these different areas you are looking to segment.

Then use the lists api to retreive those contacts
mailjet works well for this

I'm working on a pagination page, storing these data would consume lots of memories. didn't plan to use cache memory to store the data, since it's just a frontend project. but thanks anyways.. would make use of storing these data

Is there a way to show user activity when interacting via the api if my user connected via a private app, currently in activity history it show messages like "Integration MY APP" under source rather than the user that authenticated via the app
This is HubSpot block issue with Wordpress Full site editor. When we use these blocks in page editor then it is working fine but not in Full site editor.

I had assumed reading this: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/api/oauth/tokens>

That the token (and by virtue the actions taken with that token) would be assocaited back to the user that got the token....
this is the api channel — Do you have a link to the plugin for download?
is this in a seperatee webapp or inside a HubSpot website?
if a hubspoit website, can’t you use hubl or graphql for this?
Also, storing data inside a javascript object isn’t going to take up a bunch of memories
Can you let me know what you are trying to do, it sounds like you are doing something backwards.

You would need to set this up if you are trying to do this. you can access the email address. I’d suggest creating a custom property on whatever objects you are updating, and sending the data. in that regard. It might be better to use the user id, then you could create the property as a user field
Please check the link: <https://wordpress.org/plugins/leadin/>
if your wordpress is updated and the plugin is updated, I’d refer to <https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/leadin/> for support on this
Found a much better solution in the Timeline Events API <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/timeline>
Much easier to find a good solution when you know the requirements!
indeed i was really hoping the activity would be logged as the authenticating user - but am relieved there's an API to express the changes my app users make against the objects in their hub :rocket:
Perfect use case for that api here. Having a user source wouldn’t be very clear for reporting efforts

We are using the HubSpot API for custom workflow actions: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/automation/custom-workflow-actions>

We are coming across an error, as we use the `hs_execution_state`  to block and unblock contacts in workflows. However when we are unblocking on certain accounts we are receiving an error:

`Callback with ID XXXX not found for App ID XXXX`

But we receive the callback ID right before, so not sure why it shows that HubSpot doesn't have the Callback ID anymore?

Is this affecting others, we have a few accounts receiving this error? Not sure if we should attempt to have them re-integrate, or if there is another bug happening here?
<@U03MLCLS5BN> Just wanted to check in if there was any further status updates pertaining to the above request around adding email id support as a part of Upsert

I am also getting a similar error. I had given the permission to my application ( CRM list read - required ). I  am not sure on how to resolve this. Please let me know if you know something about this.

Hi All,
I have recently enabled a scope for my application ( CRM list read). After that, when i try to authorize, i get the error, that "Authorization failed because this account doesn't have access to the scopes required by the app". I don't know how to ensure that the account also have access to ( CRM list read). Thanks for taking the time to read this.
